statement.p: In the model \displaystyle{A}={1640}\cdot{\left({2}^{{\frac{{t}}{{31}}}}\right)} what is the percent increase or decrease?
Note all numbers are scientific measurements.

solution.p: The percent increase/decrease is calculated from \displaystyle{2}^{{\frac{{1}}{{31}}}}\approx{1.0226114356013}. Because this is bigger than 1, this is a percent increase and the result is \displaystyle{1.0226114356013}-{1}={0.022611435601268}\approx{0.023} and the percent is 2.3.
We round to 2 significant digits because the measurement (exponent) had 2 significant digits.
